Class UserDao

java.lang.Object
DAO.DAO<User>
DAO.UserDao
public class UserDao extends DAO<User>
This class provides the user database access functionality
Author:
24862664

    • findAll

      public ArrayList<User> findAll(int id, HashMap<String,Object> sortParams)
      Retrieves all users from the database, optionally sorted by specified parameters.
      Specified by:
      findAll in class DAO<User>
      Parameters:
      id - The user ID for filtering results (not used in this method).
      sortParams - A map of column names and sorting directions (ASC/DESC).
      Returns:
      A list of users matching the criteria, potentially sorted.

    • getUsersSortedByUsernameDesc

      Returns:

    • getUser

      public User getUser(int userId)
      Retrieves a user by their unique ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to fetch.
      Returns:
      The user with the specified ID.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If no user is found with the given ID.
      SQLException - If an error occurs while fetching the user.

    • getAddresses

      public List<Address> getAddresses(int userId)
      Retrieves a list of addresses for a given user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose addresses are to be fetched.
      Returns:
      A list of Address objects associated with the given user.

    • getUserWithAddresses

      Retrieves a user along with their associated addresses.

      Returns:

    • getAddress

      public Address getAddress(int userId, int addressId)
      Retrieves a specific address for a given user by address ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to fetch the address for.
      addressId - The ID of the address to fetch.
      Returns:
      The Address object matching the provided user and address IDs, or null if not found.

    • getRoleId

      private int getRoleId(String role)
      Retrieves the role ID corresponding to a given role name.
      Parameters:
      role - the name of the role (e.g., "admin", "customer", etc.)
      Returns:
      the role ID associated with the given role name, or 0 if not found

    • addUserRole

      private int addUserRole(int id, String role)
      Adds a user to the user_roles table by associating the user with a specific role.
      Parameters:
      id - the user ID to be added to the user_roles table
      role - the role name to be assigned to the user
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected by the insert operation (should be 1 if successful, 0 if failed)

    • getLastIdEntry

      private int getLastIdEntry()
      Retrieves the last inserted user ID from the users table.
      Returns:
      the last user ID inserted into the users table, or 0 if no entries exist

    • populateRolesTable

      private boolean populateRolesTable()
      Populates the roles table with predefined roles: 'customer', 'admin', and 'business'.
      Returns:
      true if the roles were successfully inserted into the table, false if an error occurred

    • dropUserTable

      public String dropUserTable(String table)
      Drops the user-related tables from the database. This includes dropping the user_roles, users, and roles tables.
      Parameters:
      table - the table name to validate before dropping (for security)
      Returns:
      a message indicating whether the table was dropped or an error occurred

    • getUserRoles

      public ArrayList<String> getUserRoles(int id)
      Retrieves all the roles assigned to a specific user by user ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the user ID whose roles are being fetched
      Returns:
      a list of role names associated with the user

    • isUserAdmin

      public boolean isUserAdmin(int id)
      Checks if a user has the 'admin' role.
      Parameters:
      id - the user ID to be checked for the 'admin' role
      Returns:
      true if the user has the 'admin' role, false otherwise

    • giveAdminStatus

      public int giveAdminStatus(int id)
      Grants the 'admin' role to the specified user.
      Parameters:
      id - the user ID to whom the 'admin' role will be assigned
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected by the operation (should be 1 if successful, 0 if failed)

    • removeAdminById

      public int removeAdminById(int id)
      Removes the 'admin' role from a user, if they have other roles as well. If the user only has the 'admin' role, the removal is prevented.
      Parameters:
      id - the user ID from which the 'admin' role will be removed
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected by the operation (should be 1 if successful, 0 if failed)

    • getUserIdFromUsername

      public int getUserIdFromUsername(String username)
      Retrieves the user ID associated with a given username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user whose ID is being fetched
      Returns:
      the user ID associated with the provided username
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no user is found with the given username
